required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Reduced Exposure Study in Smokers Using the Tobacco Heating System 2.2 (THS 2.2) for 5 Days in a Confinement Setting
clinical_study.official_title: A Controlled, 3-arm Parallel Group Study to Demonstrate Reduction in Exposure to Smoke Constituents in Healthy Smokers Switching to THS 2.2 or to Smoking Abstinence, Compared to Conventional Cigarettes for 5 Days in Confinement

brief_summary.textblock: The overall goal of the study is to evaluate if the ad libitum use of the Tobacco Heating System 2.2 (THS 2.2) for 5 consecutive days by adult Japanese healthy smokers affects the levels of biomarkers of exposure for selected harmful and potentially harmful constituents (HPHCs) compared to smoking conventional cigarettes (CC) and smoking abstinence (SA).

primary_outcome.description: Concentrations measured at Day 5 in urine, adjusted for creatinine. Geometric Least Squares LS) means are provided as descriptive statistics.
Concentrations measured at Day 5 in urine, adjusted for creatinine. Geometric Least Squares means are provided as descriptive statistics.
Concentrations measured at Day 5 in urine, adjusted for creatinine. Geometric Least Squares means are provided as descriptive statistics.
% COHb blood measurements performed in the evening of Day 5, expressed as % of saturation of hemoglobin. Geometric Least Squares means are provided as descriptive statistics.

arm_group.description: Ad libitum use of THS 2.2 for 5 days in confinement
Abstinence from smoking for 5 days in confinement
Ad libitum use of Subject's own preferred brand of CC for 5 days in confinement

intervention.description: THS 2.2 ad libitum for 5 days in confinement
Subject's own preferred brand of CC ad libitum for 5 days in confinement

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Subject is Japanese.
- Smoking, healthy subject as judged by the Investigator.
- Subject smokes at least 10 commercially available non-menthol CCs per day (no brand restrictions) for the last 4 weeks, based on self reporting.
- Subject has smoked for at least the last 3 consecutive years.
- Subject does not plan to quit smoking in the next 3 months.
Exclusion Criteria:
- As per Investigator judgment, the subject cannot participate in the study for any reason (e.g., medical, psychiatric, and/or social reason).
- The subject has received medication within 14 days or within 5 half-lives of the medication (whichever is longer), which has an impact on CYP1A2 or CYP2A6 activity.
- For women: Subject is pregnant or is breast feeding.
- For women: Subject does not agree to use an acceptable method of effective contraception.

facility.name: Higashi Shinjuku Clinic, Daito Building, 1-11-3, Okubo, Shinjuku-ku

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Study initiated (first subject screened): 23 July 2013 At admission (Day -2), all the subjects performed a product trial of the THS 2.2. During the baseline period, they continued smoking their single preferred brand of CC. Then, on Day 0, subjects were randomized to one of the 3 study arms (THS 2.2, CC or SA) in a 2:1:1 ratio.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Enrolled and randomized population = 160 subjects 80 subjects in THS 2.2 40 subjects in CC 40 subjects in SA Number of subjects enrolled but NOT randomized (who tried the THS 2.2 at Day -2) = 6

group.title: Tobacco Heating System (THS 2.2)
group.description: Ad libitum use of THS 2.2 for 5 days in confinement

group.title: Conventional Cigarette (CC)
group.description: Ad libitum use of Subject's own preferred brand of CC for 5 days in confinement

group.title: Smoking Abstinence (SA)
group.description: Abstinence from smoking for 5 days in confinement

baseline.population: The study population consisted of all the randomized subjects who had at least 1 post randomization product use experience (THS 2.2 or CC arms), and 1 valid biomarker of exposure (BoExp) measurement. 160 randomized subjects: 80 in THS 2.2, 40 in CC and 40 in SA 158 completers: 2 subjects (SA arm) voluntarily withdrew on Day 1 and Day 3

group.title: Tobacco Heating System (THS 2.2)
group.description: Ad libitum use of THS 2.2 for 5 days in confinement

group.title: Conventional Cigarette (CC)
group.description: Ad libitum use of Subject's own preferred brand of CC for 5 days in confinement

group.title: Smoking Abstinence (SA)
group.description: Abstinence from smoking for 5 days in confinement

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

outcome.title: Concentration of Monohydroxybutenyl Mercapturic Acid (MHBMA)
outcome.description: Concentrations measured at Day 5 in urine, adjusted for creatinine. Geometric Least Squares LS) means are provided as descriptive statistics.
outcome.population: The analysis was performed on the full analysis set (FAS) population. The FAS consisted of all the randomized subjects who had at least 1 post randomization product use experience (if randomized to THS 2.2 or CC) and had at least 1 valid biomarker of exposure (BoExp) measurement (THS 2.2, CC, SA arms).

group.title: Tobacco Heating System (THS 2.2)
group.description: Ad libitum use of THS 2.2 for 5 days in confinement

group.title: Conventional Cigarette (CC)
group.description: Ad libitum use of subject's own preferred brand of CC for 5 days in confinement

group.title: Smoking Abstinence (SA)
group.description: Abstinence from smoking for 5 days in confinement

measure.title: Concentration of Monohydroxybutenyl Mercapturic Acid (MHBMA)
measure.description: Concentrations measured at Day 5 in urine, adjusted for creatinine. Geometric Least Squares LS) means are provided as descriptive statistics.
measure.population: The analysis was performed on the full analysis set (FAS) population. The FAS consisted of all the randomized subjects who had at least 1 post randomization product use experience (if randomized to THS 2.2 or CC) and had at least 1 valid biomarker of exposure (BoExp) measurement (THS 2.2, CC, SA arms).

analysis.groups_desc: The hypothesis to be tested is that the geometric mean level on Day 5 of the biomarker of exposure for THS 2.2 is lower relative to CC. Analysis of the BoExp was conducted on the natural log scale in order to test the following hypothesis (one sided test with 2.5% type I error probability): Null hypothesis (H0): m1≥m2 Alternative hypothesis (H1): m1<m2 Where m1 and m2 are the geometric means of the BoExp levels on Day 5 for THS 2.2 and CC respectively.
analysis.p_value_desc: The primary endpoints were tested using a multiple testing procedure to preserve the overall alpha level by simultaneously testing the endpoints using a closed procedure with each test performed at an alpha level of 2.5% one sided.
analysis.method_desc: ANCOVA model on MHBMA levels with product, sex, cigarette consumption, and baseline value as covariates.

outcome.title: Concentration of 3-hydroxypropylmercapturic Acid (3-HPMA)
outcome.description: Concentrations measured at Day 5 in urine, adjusted for creatinine. Geometric Least Squares means are provided as descriptive statistics.
outcome.population: The analysis was performed on the full analysis set (FAS) population. The FAS consisted of all the randomized subjects who had at least 1 post randomization product use experience (if randomized to THS 2.2 or CC) and had at least 1 valid BoExp measurement (THS 2.2, CC, SA arms).

outcome.title: Levels of Carboxyhemoglobin (COHb)
outcome.description: % COHb blood measurements performed in the evening of Day 5, expressed as % of saturation of hemoglobin. Geometric Least Squares means are provided as descriptive statistics.
outcome.population: The analysis was performed on the full analysis set (FAS) population. The FAS consisted of all the randomized subjects who had at least 1 post randomization product use experience (if randomized to THS 2.2 or CC) and had at least 1 valid BoExp measurement (THS 2.2, CC, SA arms).

reported_events.time_frame: From the informed consent form (ICF) signature until the end of the safety follow-up period (7 days after discharge of the subject).
reported_events.desc: The safety was assessed in the safety population, consisting of 166 subjects: 160 randomized subjects (80 in THS 2.2, 40 in CC and 40 in SA) and 6 subjects exposed to THS 2.2 from the product trial on Day -2 but not randomized.

group.title: Tobacco Heating System (THS 2.2)
group.description: Ad libitum use of THS 2.2 for 5 days in confinement

group.title: Conventional Cigarette (CC)
group.description: Ad libitum use of Subject's own preferred brand of CC for 5 days in confinement

group.title: Smoking Abstinence (SA)
group.description: Abstinence from smoking for 5 days in confinement

group.title: Enrolled But Not Randomized
group.description: Subjects who tried the THS 2.2 at Admission (Day -2) but were not randomized in 1 of the 3 arms as they were back-up subjects

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: We confirm we have the contractual provisions in place which specifies that in no event will the study site be allowed to disclose to any third party (or publicly release) any information obtained through the study without the CRO's prior written consent which in turn cannot provide such consent without Sponsor's approval unless such publication is made to satisfy regulatory requirements. The Intellectual Property rights and research results from the present study belongs to the Sponsor.
